Description: A man's coat; floor length, centre front opening but with lower part [64 cms from hem] stitched together. Made from natural cream silk cloth with predominantly blue stripes (tabby and supplementary warp); seven separate panels, creating a flared shape. The long straight sleeves have a vent and extending beyond the bottom of the sleeve is a tapering length of cream silk with a pink tassel attached. Beige coloured silk braiding applied to the neckline and most of the front opening, the bottom of the sleeves, and (partially) at the side vents. Half lined with natural cream coloured tabby woven cotton cloth. Deep pockets in side seams.
Production place: Made in: Libya (?: source: Sahar el-Sayed)
Made in: Tunisia (?: source: Sahar el-Sayed)
Made in: Jordan (?: source: Sahar el-Sayed)
Curator's comments: Donations and Purchases Book Volume 9: 'Arab' and 'Five pieces comprising an Arab costume'; Asia Collections storage intake book: 'Middle East'. In the opinion of Sahar el-Sayed (textile curator, Cairo Textile Museum) these clothes are festive dress, worn by a man living in a rural environment. Garment worn with As1979,14 .1 jacket .2 waistcoat .4 shawl, scarf .5 coat, 'abaya'
